meanings.sent1: The magician's trick created an illusion of a disappearing rabbit.
meanings.sent2: The mirage in the desert was just an illusion.
meanings.sent3: The funhouse mirror gave the illusion of a person with a giant head.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an illusion hiding the pain she felt inside.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house was full of spooky illusions that scared the visitors.

meanings.definition: Something that deceives the senses or mind
meanings.sent1: The optical illusion made it seem like the lines were moving.
meanings.sent2: The hologram was a stunning illusion at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The fake spider on the wall was a harmless illusion to scare her sister.
meanings.sent4: The sound of waves crashing was an illusion created by the white noise machine.
meanings.sent5: The magician's illusion of levitating was mind-boggling to the audience.

meanings.sent1: The shimmering water created the illusion of a lake in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly figure was just an illusion caused by the fog.
meanings.sent3: The low-hanging clouds gave the illusion of mountains in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises were just an illusion to win votes.
meanings.sent5: The stage lights created an illusion of a starry night for the play.
